parameters.description: A valid access token from the Spotify Accounts service: see the [Web API Authorization Guide](https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/general/guides/authorization-guide/) for details. The `user-library-read` [scope](https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/general/guides/authorization-guide/#list-of-scopes) must have been authorized by the user.
parameters.name: Authorization

parameters.description:
An [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2). If a country code is specified, only episodes that are available in that market will be returned.  
If a valid user access token is specified in the request header, the country associated with the user account will take priority over this parameter.  
*Note: If neither market or user country are provided, the content is considered unavailable for the client.*   
Users can view the country that is associated with their account in the [account settings](https://www.spotify.com/se/account/overview/).
parameters.name: market

parameters.description: The maximum number of objects to return. Default: 20. Minimum: 1. Maximum: 50.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The index of the first object to return. Default: 0 (i.e., the first object). Use with `limit` to get the next set of objects.
parameters.name: offset

externalDocs.description: Find more info on the official Spotify Web API Reference

href.description: A link to the Web API endpoint returning the full result of the request

externalDocs.description: Find more info on the official Spotify Web API Reference

added_at.description: The date and time the episode was saved. Timestamps are returned in ISO 8601 format as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) with a zero offset: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

limit.description: The maximum number of items in the response (as set in the query or by default).

next.description: URL to the next page of items. ( `null` if none)

offset.description: The offset of the items returned (as set in the query or by default)

previous.description: URL to the previous page of items. ( `null` if none)

total.description: The total number of items available to return.

200.description: - On success, the HTTP status code in the response header is `200` OK and the response body contains an array of [saved episode objects](https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api/reference/#object-savedepisodeobject) (wrapped in a [paging object](https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api/reference/#object-pagingobject)) in JSON format. On error, the header status code is an [error code](https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api/#response-status-codes) and the response body contains an [error object](https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api/#response-schema).
